sentences.sContent: He took aim and squeezed the trigger.
sentences.sCn: 他瞄准目标，扣动了扳机。

sentences.sContent: The assassination triggered off a wave of rioting.
sentences.sCn: 这次暗杀事件引发了一阵骚乱。

sentences.sContent: ...we can change how often we receive the distracting notifications that trigger our urge to check...
...stripping cartons of their branding will trigger no mass movement to quit...

...a perishing rain forest could trigger a domino effect - sending winds and rains kilometers off course and loading the skies with even greater levels of greenhouse gases - that will be felt far beyond the Amazon basin...
...This could trigger a memory about what you’re talking about through that lecture...

remMethod.val: 扣动扳机(trigger)射杀了一只老虎(tiger)

trans.tranOther: the part of a gun that you pull with your finger to fire it
to make something happen very quickly, especially a series of events
